node.title: SA Opposition Leader returns negative COVID test as parliament shutdown begins
node.alt: SA Opposition Leader Peter Malinauskas wears a surgical mask.
node.description: South Australia's Opposition Leader and his deputy returnÂ negative COVID-19 tests after being identified as close contacts of former premier Jay Weatherill, who last night tested positive.
node.content: ["South Australia's Opposition Leader and his deputy have returned negative COVID-19 tests after being identified as close contacts of the former premier, who last night tested positive.", "Peter Malinauskas and Susan Close both received negative results from their first COVID tests, but will still have to isolate for seven days under state health guidelines.", "As a result, South Australia's parliament will be adjourned today\u00a0and all MPs and staff directed to avoid in-person meetings.", "It comes after former premier Jay Weatherill contracted COVID-19 after attending an event\u00a0over the weekend where other cases were present.", "Mr Weatherill, who works for Andrew Forrest's Minderoo Foundation, was in Adelaide to begin an interstate tour as CEO of the foundation's Thrive by Five campaign, promoting early childhood development.", "He held a press conference on Monday morning and was set to speak at other events in Victoria in the coming days.", "An Adelaide breakfast radio show is also broadcasting from quarantine this morning after Mr Weatherill visited the station, FiveAA, for an interview on Tuesday.", "Meanwhile, a school\u00a0in Adelaide's north-west, Ocean View College B-12, is closed for cleaning and contact tracing today after confirming a member of its school community had tested positive.", "\"SA Health will contact close or casual contacts to provide more information,\" a statement from the Department of Education said on Wednesday night.", "\"In the meantime, we encourage staff and students to monitor for any COVID-19 symptoms, test if symptomatic and isolate until you receive a negative result.\""]
